What are SSI?

SSI (Server Side Includes) are a set of directives that can be put in a HTML page and interpreted by the web server while it sends the page to a client. You can use SSI to insert in your HTML page:

  • The value of an environment variable.

  • The size and the last modification time of a file.

  • A file.

  • The output of a script or a shell command.
